chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
D: cpo
f: D -> D
C: continuous f

Goal:
monotone pow

Premises:
monotone : forall T1 T2 : poset, (T1 -> T2) -> Prop
continuous : forall D1 D2 : cpo, (D1 -> D2) -> Prop
app_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- Type] ?T : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- poset]
dapp_mono : forall x : ?A, monotone (@^~ x) where ?A : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- Type] ?T : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- ?A -> poset]
Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> ?sT where ?T : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- Type] ?P : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- pred ?T] ?sT : [D : cpo f : D -> D C : continuous f |- subType ?P]
cont_mono : forall (D1 D2 : cpo) (f : D1 -> D2), continuous f -> monotone f
tarski_lfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_lfp f) = tarski_lfp f
tarski_gfp_fixed : forall (T : lattice) (f : T -> T), monotone f -> f (tarski_gfp f) = tarski_gfp f
image_chain : forall T1 T2 : poset, chain T1 -> forall f : T1 -> T2, monotone f -> chain T2
pow = fix pow (m : nat) : D := match m with | 0 => bot | n.+1 => f (pow n) end : nat -> D Arguments pow _%nat_scope
lift_chain : forall D : cpo, chain D -> chain D
contE : forall (D1 D2 : cpo) (f : D1 -> D2) (s : chain D1) (C : continuous f), f (lim s) = lim [f^^sbycont_mono C]
image_chainP : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (s : chain T1) (f : T1 -> T2), monotone f -> chain_axiom [Pred x2 | exists x1 : T1, x2 = f x1 /\ x1 \In s]
PeanoNat.Nat.eqf = fun f g : nat -> bool => forall n : nat, f n = g n : (nat -> bool) -> (nat -> bool) -> Prop Arguments PeanoNat.Nat.eqf (_ _)%function_scope
sub_bot : forall (D : cpo) (s : Pred D), chain_closed s -> {x : D | Mem s x}
comp_mono = fun (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (x y : T3) (H : x <== y) => M1 (f2 x) (f2 y) (M2 x y H) : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> monotone (f1 \o f2) Arguments comp_mono {T1 T2 T3} {f1 f2}%function_scope
prod_chain : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2), monotone f1 -> monotone f2 -> chain [posetofS1 * S2] -> chain (pairPoset T1 T2)
comp_chainE : forall (T1 T2 T3 : poset) (f1 : T2 -> T1) (f2 : T3 -> T2) (s : chain T3) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2), [f1^^[f2^^sbyM2]byM1] = [f1 \o f2^^sbycomp_mono M1 M2]
proj1_prodE : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (s : chain [posetofS1 * S2]), proj1_chain (prod_chain M1 M2 s) = [f1^^proj1_chain sbyM1]
proj2_prodE : forall (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (s : chain [posetofS1 * S2]), proj2_chain (prod_chain M1 M2 s) = [f2^^proj2_chain sbyM2]
comp = fun (A B C : Type) (f : B -> A) (g : C -> B) (x : C) => f (g x) : forall A B C : Type, (B -> A) -> (C -> B) -> C -> A Arguments comp {A B C}%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope _ /
sval_mono : forall (D : cpo) (s : Pred D), monotone sval
id_chainE : forall (T : poset) (s : chain T) (M : monotone id), [id^^sbyM] = s
prod_mono = fun (S1 S2 T1 T2 : poset) (f1 : S1 -> T1) (f2 : S2 -> T2) (M1 : monotone f1) (M2 : monotone f2) (__top_assumption_ : pairPoset S1 S2) => (fun _evar_0_ : forall (a : S1) (b : S2), (fun p : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p <== (f1 \* f2) y) (a, b) => let (x, x0) as p return ((fun p0 : S1 * S2 => forall y : pairPoset S1 S2, p0 <== y -> (f1 \* f2) p0 <== (f1 \* f2) y) p) := __top_assumption_ in _evar_0_ x x0) (...
id_mono = fun (T : poset) (x y : T) => id : forall T : poset, monotone id Arguments id_mono {T}
const_mono = fun (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2) (x y0 : T1) => fun=> poset_refl y : forall (T1 T2 : poset) (y : T2), monotone (fun=> y) Arguments const_mono {T1 T2 y}
diag_mono = fun (T : poset) (x y : T) (H : x <== y) => conj H H : forall T : poset, monotone (fun x : T => (x, x)) Arguments diag_mono {T}
fprod : forall A1 A2 B1 B2 : Type, (A1 -> B1) -> (A2 -> B2) -> A1 * A2 -> B1 * B2
fun_leq : forall (A : Type) (B : poset), (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop
ssr_suff : forall Plemma Pgoal : Type, (Plemma -> Pgoal) -> Plemma -> Pgoal
Field_theory.mk_afield : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> ~ req rI rO -> (forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))) -> (forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI) -> Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req
Inductive proof : Set := Hyp : forall e : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 e -> Ztac.proof | Add : Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof | Mul : Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof -> Ztac.proof | Cst : BinNums.Z -> Ztac.proof Arguments Ztac.Hyp {e}%Z_scope Arguments Ztac.Cst _%Z_scope
